Format citation in Chicago style

Source: R/format_citation.R
format_chicago.Rd

Creates a citation formatted according to Chicago Manual of Style guidelines from BibTeX data.

Usage

format_chicago(bibtex_data, link_doi = TRUE)

Arguments

bibtex_data

A list containing BibTeX fields for a publication.

link_doi

Logical indicating whether DOIs should be formatted as hyperlinks. Default is TRUE.

Value

A character string containing the Chicago-formatted citation, or NA if formatting fails.

Details

Chicago style formatting includes:

  • Authors: first author in "Last, First" format, subsequent authors in "First Last" format

  • For 1-3 authors: all authors listed

  • For 4+ authors: first author et al.

  • Year after authors

  • Title in quotation marks

  • Journal name in italics

  • Format: Author(s). Year. "Title." Journal Volume, no. Issue: Pages.

See also

format_citation for the main citation formatting function.

Examples

# create BibTeX data
bibtex_data <- list(
  entry_type = "article",
  author = "Smith, John and Johnson, Sarah",
  year = "2023",
  title = "Example research paper",
  journal = "Journal of Examples",
  volume = "45",
  number = "2",
  pages = "123-145",
  doi = "10.1234/example"
)

format_chicago(bibtex_data)
#> [1] "Smith, John, and Sarah Johnson. 2023. \"Example research paper.\" *Journal of Examples* 45, no. 2: 123-145 [doi:10.1234/example](https://doi.org/10.1234/example)"
